fields.title: Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, January - March 2023
fields.body:
The Syria crisis entered its thirteenth year in March 2023. The UN estimates that [15.3 million](https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-2023-humanitarian-needs-overview-december-2022) people need humanitarian assistance across the country, a 5 per cent increase from 2022.

The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation in Syria, and UNHCR is responding to this new emergency. An estimated [8.8 million](https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/flash-appeal-syrian-arab-republic-earthquake-february-may-2023) people in Syria were affected by the earthquakes.

UNHCR also continues to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members based on identified needs and vulnerabilities.

text:
# Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, January - March 2023

The Syria crisis entered its thirteenth year in March 2023. The UN estimates that [15.3 million](https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/syrian-arab-republic-2023-humanitarian-needs-overview-december-2022) people need humanitarian assistance across the country, a 5 per cent increase from 2022.

The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation in Syria, and UNHCR is responding to this new emergency. An estimated [8.8 million](https://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/flash-appeal-syrian-arab-republic-earthquake-february-may-2023) people in Syria were affected by the earthquakes.

UNHCR also continues to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members based on identified needs and vulnerabilities.
summary: The Syria crisis entered its thirteenth year in March 2023, with an estimated 15.3 million people in need of humanitarian assistance. The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation, affecting 8.8 million people. UNHCR is responding to this new emergency and continuing to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members.
